metadata.case_name: Bhagwat Dayal and others v. Lala Nanak Chand Trust and others
metadata.case_number: Writ Petition No. 105 of 1969; Civil Appeals Nos. 1402 and 1403 of 1969

facts.text: Plot No. 4635A (old number 5199) located in Meerut municipality, area of 1 bigha and 2 biswas, part of zamindari estate of Lala Nanak Chand Trust, charitable trust vested in Treasurer of Charitable Endowments, managed by Collector of Meerut through committee of trustees.

On June 23, 1926, lease deed executed by trust in favour of Bateshwar Dayal for plot to plant grove, erect buildings, dig wells etc., yearly rent Rs. 12/8/-, term 30 years from June 1, 1926; lessee to surrender land and buildings to lessor on expiry without compensation; lessor to grant new 30-year lease at lessee's request.
Initial 30-year lease expired on July 1, 1956; trust instituted Suit No. 690 of 1956 for possession from Bateshwar Dayal.
During pendency of Suit No. 690/1956, Bateshwar Dayal died on March 6, 1958.
Trial court dismissed Suit No. 690/1956 on October 24, 1958.
First appellate court decreed Suit No. 690/1956 on November 30, 1959, granted six months to defendants to institute suit for specific performance of agreement to re-let.
Bhagwat Dayal and others (heirs of Bateshwar Dayal) instituted Suit No. 34 of 1960 for specific performance of agreement to re-let for 30 years; trust contested inter alia on limitation.
Trial court dismissed Suit No. 34/1960 on October 30, 1961 upholding limitation.
First appellate court affirmed dismissal of Suit No. 34/1960 on March 23, 1962.
Bhagwat Dayal and others filed Second Appeal No. 425 of 1960 against decree in trust's suit on January 5, 1960, and Second Appeal No. 1649 of 1962 against their own suit on April 23, 1962.
U.P. Urban Area Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1956 enforced in Meerut; land declared agricultural area; notification issued June 16, 1964 under s.8 vesting land in State.
Bhagwat Dayal applied to High Court for abatement of appeals and suits under the Act; High Court ordered abatement on July 25, 1968.

Appellants filed Civil Appeals Nos. 1402 and 1403 of 1969 by special leave against High Court abatement order; Writ Petition No. 105 of 1969 to quash s.8 notification, alleging plot part of residential Kothi Babu Wali, non-agricultural.

In suits, respondents (trust) case that Bateshwar Dayal planted grove; trial court commissioner report October 16, 1956: western half vacant, few trees on boundaries, 18-19 scattered guava trees in eastern half.
State filed counter-affidavit assuming wrong plot number, did not address allegation that land is non-agricultural part of residential kothi.

legal_issues.text: Whether the disputed land is 'agricultural area' under Section 2(1)(d) of the U.P. Urban Area Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1956, given the lease purpose included erecting buildings but no buildings constructed and possible grove.
Whether Section 2(1)(d) of the Act is violative of Articles 14, 19 and 31 of the Constitution and unprotected by Article 31A.
Whether the land was being used for agriculture or horticulture on the relevant date specified under Section 2(1), qualifying as grove-land under U.P. Tenancy Act, 1939.

petitioner_arguments.text: Lease was for purpose of erecting buildings, falls under cl. (d) of s.2(1); cl.(d) violative of Articles 14, 19 and 31, invalid; thus land not agricultural area, notification invalid.
Disputed plot part of residential Kothi Babu Wali within Meerut municipality, non-agricultural.

respondent_arguments.text: Bateshwar Dayal planted grove on land; grove existing on relevant date, used as grove, covered by s.2(1)(c)(viii), not exclusively under s.2(1)(d).

court_reasoning.text: Lease not exclusively building lease; lessee could plant grove instead; no buildings constructed; if grove planted and used as such on relevant date, covered by s.2(1)(c)(viii), not solely cl.(d).
court_reasoning.key_observation: Cannot place lease exclusively under cl.(d).

court_reasoning.text: s.2(1)(d) connected to agricultural reform; limits to lands used for crops, grove or pasture on relevant date, taking colour from other clauses and context of Act; protected by Art.31A.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Agricultural area in s.2(1)(d) construed as lands in agricultural area used for agriculture/horticulture.

court_reasoning.text: History of s.2(1)(d): originally included 'but which is being used for agriculture'; deleted as redundant; supports limitation to agricultural use.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Avoids anomaly where lessee gets bhumidhari only on used portions.

court_reasoning.text: Commissioner report shows not clearly grove-land under s.2(6) U.P. Tenancy Act; State counter-affidavit evasive; issue whether agricultural area and used for horticulture needs fresh determination under ss.3-5.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No concluded opinion possible; remand for enquiry.

holdings.text: Section 2(1)(d) limited to lands used for growing crops, grove or pasture on relevant date; connected to agricultural reform, protected by Art.31A, not violative of Arts.14,19,31.
Only lands used for agriculture/horticulture acquirable under Act; disputed land's status requires fresh demarcation under ss.3,4,5.
If found non-agricultural, no s.8 notification; suits/appeals proceed on merits; if agricultural and notified, dispose per Act.

precedents_cited.case_name: Durga Prasad v. Board of Revenue U.P. Allahabad
precedents_cited.relevance: History of s.2(1)(d); held limited to lands used for agricultural purposes; Court reaches same conclusion for different reasons.

statutes_cited.name: U.P. Urban Area Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1956
statutes_cited.relevance: Defines agricultural area, vesting in State, settlement as bhumidhar, abatement of suits; Court construes s.2(1)(d) narrowly.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Writ under Art.32; challenge to s.2(1)(d) as violative; protected by 31A.

statutes_cited.name: U.P. Urban Areas Zamindari Abolition and Land Reform Rules, 1957

outcome.summary: Writ petition allowed: s.8 notification dated June 16, 1964 quashed for disputed land; Government directed to proceed afresh under ss.3,4,5,8. Appeals allowed: High Court abatement order set aside; restore appeals/suits to be decided per fresh findings under Act.
outcome.relief_granted: Quash notification; remand for fresh demarcation; restore suits/appeals.

key_quotes.text: "s. 2 (1) (d), though apparently expressed in wide language, is limited to lands which, are on the relevant date being used for growing crops or as grove or as pasture land."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding on construction of s.2(1)(d)

key_quotes.text: "The Act as a whole is protected by Article 31A of the Constitution."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "we allow the writ petition and quash the Government notification under s. 8 of the Act, dated June 16, 1964 with respect to the land in dispute."
key_quotes.speaker: court
